intro: Bidens zairensis, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, spiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Bidens zairensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
